result.name: benthic-sampling-from-aggregate-extraction-environmental-assessment-reference-station-1998-2006
result.notes:
Benthic sampling data from 0.1m2 Hamon grabs taken at a network of selected 
benthic sampling stations within the Isle of Wight and Eastern English Channel 
regions between 1998-2005. These stations were defined as Environmental 
Assessment Reference Stations (EARS). Data is selected site monitoring, 
containing details of macrofauna found in each sample.

This data was part of a continuation of a time-series under a previous Defra 
project (AO903) within the Isle of Wight and Cross Sands regions. Newly 
acquired and existing data from each of the three sampling locations has been 
analysed independently following a standardised analytical approach and 
results presented in three site-specific peer-reviewed publications.

organization.name: marine-environmental-data-information-network
organization.title: Marine Environmental Data & Information Network
organization.description: MEDIN is a partnership of UK organisations committed to improving access to marine data. Our partners are both public and private sector.

result.title: Benthic Sampling From Aggregate Extraction Environmental Assessment Reference Stations - Isle of Wight and Eastern English Channel 1998-2006

resources.description: The Cefas Data Portal contains metadata records and data sets available to download and connect to in support of our commitment to open science. Data is available in the following formats: CSV, ESRI Shapefile. The data can also be accessed via the WFS and WMS protocols.
resources.name: Cefas Data Portal
